metadata.synopsis: The players encounters Ketheric's undead hound in his chambers while sneaking around the tower. She's territorial - but if she smells Isobel's blessing on us she'll recognise Selunite magic. She reveals that she misses the way her master used to be.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Walk into Ketherics room and get spotted by the hound (-167; 37; -172).

7.speaker: Squire
7.text: Stand, soldier! These are the General's private quarters.

45.speaker: Squire
45.text: ...Wait. Something in your scent is... familiar.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: I'm just exploring the tower. I mean no harm.

4.speaker: Squire
4.text: You stumble into trouble like a stray pup. My own litter were the same.

33.speaker: Squire
33.text: But they are long dead, now. Mind where you stray, lest I send you to join them.

25.speaker: Squire
25.text: I cannot tell if your stink is lies or stupidity. It doesn't matter.

23.speaker: Squire
23.text: Ugh. The General has led many soldiers - and your form is by far the sloppiest.

40.speaker: Squire
40.text: Just be about your task then - whatever it is.

83.speaker: Squire
83.text: ...I do not know which army you fight for, but it is not my master's.
83.context: NodeContext: nonplussed at our terrible salute, attacks

94.speaker: Player
94.text: Down, lapdog. A True Soul walks where they please.

80.speaker: Squire
80.text: ...Hmph. Walk carefully, then. Or I will learn exactly what True Soul tastes like.
80.context: NodeContext: intimidated, but giving a parting shot

90.speaker: Squire
90.text: You will not walk out again.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Stay still and let her smell you.

27.speaker: Squire
27.text: I do not know your face, but your scent... Selûnite magic. It used to fill these halls, back when I was flesh.

62.speaker: Squire
62.text: Since my master brought me back... this place smells wrong. His family is gone, replaced by bootlickers and beasts.

79.speaker: Squire
79.text: You are neither. So tell me true - what is your purpose here?

58.speaker: Player
58.text: To serve Ketheric - as loyally as you do.

84.speaker: Squire
84.text: Good. Death itself cannot release you from that duty. Now be about your business, whatever it is.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: My scent seemed to trigger a memory in you. What was it?

87.speaker: Squire
87.text: Not your scent - Selûnite magic on your skin. The General once smelled that way, when his daughter still lived.

42.speaker: Squire
42.text: I... died the same night she did, my master says. Trying to protect her. I do not remember.

9.speaker: Squire
9.text: But he brought me back. I will not fail him again.

30.speaker: Squire
30.text: Your scent is familiar to me, stranger - but I can still smell the lies underneath.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: I only want to stop the Absolute.

41.speaker: Squire
41.text: I protect my master. What becomes of his master, I care not.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: My scent seemed to trigger a memory in you. What was it?

21.speaker: Squire
21.text: Pass, then. But I will be watching.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Your master's beyond saving. I'm here to end him.

69.speaker: Squire
69.text: No! He may have changed, but he is still my master. I cannot let you pass.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: To make sure your master dies. Screaming, preferably.

68.speaker: Squire
68.text: There will be no screams from you, stranger - not when I take your throat.

60.speaker: Squire
60.text: Do you take me for a teething pup? Get that out of my face.

36.speaker: Squire
36.text: Though whichever whelp owns that thing smells... happy. Safe. I have not scented such a thing since I was flesh.
36.context: CinematicNodeContext: She hesitates and cocks her head, sniffing the air.NodeContext: She hesitates and cocks her head, sniffing the air.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: I'm a friend - I have some food to share.

49.speaker: Squire
49.text: I've had no stomach to fill for some time. But you will find my teeth are still sharp, stranger.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: Gently reach out to pet the hound.

81.speaker: Narrator
81.text: *Warily, it watches you approach. There's no flesh or fur to scratch at, only bone and cold metal...*

8.speaker: Narrator
8.text: *...but it seems the touch is enough, and for a moment the undead beast is just another dog happily wagging its tail.*
8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Re-use animation from player petting Scratch at camp.

44.speaker: Squire
44.text: I let you pass. Do not make me change my mind.

48.speaker: Narrator
48.text: *Even stripped of flesh, the war-hound is formidable. Spectral eyes meet yours as it growls a challenge.*

13.speaker: Narrator
13.text: *And then it hesitates, gleaming muzzle sampling your scent as if in... recognition?*

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Lower your eyes - you're no threat.

74.speaker: Narrator
74.text: *The hound relaxes, clearly accustomed to this show of deference within its master's chamber.*

6.speaker: Narrator
6.text: *The growl only deepens. The hound isn't reassured - or perhaps it is simply taking no chances.*

39.speaker: Narrator
39.text: *The dog relaxes, as if reassured by your observance of protocol.*

22.speaker: Narrator
22.text: *It turns away and utterly ignores you - as it would any lowly foot soldier.*

75.speaker: Narrator
75.text: *Perhaps your form was sloppy. Or perhaps the creature simply wants to taste your blood.*

11.speaker: Player
11.text: It's a trained army hound - give it your best salute.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Give the creature a snarl of your own.

51.speaker: Narrator
51.text: *This is not a creature easily cowed, but something in your display gives it pause.*

52.speaker: Narrator
52.text: *The growl withers to a whimper, and the hound turns away, sheepish.*

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Snarl at the beast's display of weakness.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Stay still and let it sniff you.

28.speaker: Narrator
28.text: *Suspicious, the creature leans in for another sniff - and for a moment, its tail wags as if remembering a scent from long ago.*

71.speaker: Narrator
71.text: *Then the beast shakes its head, a ferocious war-hound once more. Though perhaps not quite as ferocious as before.*

85.speaker: Narrator
85.text: *Scratch's scent lies heavy on the toy - the scent of play, comfort, safety. For a moment, the skeletal tail twitches.*

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Offer up some food from your pack.

88.speaker: Narrator
88.text: *The dog's growl only deepens, echoing in the cavity where its stomach used to be.*

31.speaker: Player
31.text: You seemed to know my scent. How?

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Would it be all right if I gave you a scratch?

65.speaker: Squire
65.text: You'd be the first of the General's soldiers brave enough to try.

73.speaker: Squire
73.text: Hm. Hmmm... All right, that's enough.
73.context: CinematicNodeContext: Re-use animation from player petting Scratch at camp.
